How to get:
Level requirement - 60
Name: I Am Claude's Disciple
Location: City of Auch
NPC: Claire (E-5)
Reward: Sweet Candy (3)
Details:
1. Add Claude to team.
2. Talk to Claire with Claude.
3. Remove Claude from team.
4. Talk to Claire.

Name: Proposal of the Student
Location: City of Auch
NPC: Claire
Reward: EXP Card (3)
Details:
1. Travel to Reboldeaux
2. Talk to Claude
3. Travel to City of Auch
4. Talk to Claire.

Name: Test of Master Claude Baudez
Location: City of Auch
NPC: Claire
Reward: None
Details:
1. Purchase an White Gold Bar from a merchant (1,000,000Vis).
2. Travel to Port of Coimbra.
3. Talk to Jose Cortesar 3 times.
4. Go to Lisa and buy an Avocado Sandwich.
5. Talk to Jose
6. Accept mission to be transported to an instance.
7. Travel to City of Auch
8. Return Great Sword and Elemental Jewel to Claire.

Name: Being a Merchant
Location: City of Auch
NPC: Claire
Reward: EXP Card (3)
Details:
1. Talk to Vincent Rio
2. Travel to Port of Coimbra
3. Talk to Emilia
4. Travel to Reboldeaux
5. Talk to Reboldeaux Investigation Team
6. Return to Claire for reward.

Name: Actual Hunting
Location: City of Auch
NPC: Claire
Reward: Claire Character Card, EXP Card (3), Polish Disciple (3)
Details:
1. Travel to Bonavista River
2. Kill Elite Lightning Cockatrice for 2 Unknown Ores. (recommended to squad since this is very rare drop, these drops are auto added to inventory).
Or you can alternatively buy Cockatrice Spinelles (2,000,000 vis ea from Katherine, in Ulstiur Camp), spawn and kill them.
3. Return to Claire.
4. Travel to Reboldeaux.
5. Talk to Claude.
6. Return to Claire for reward.

Quest Tips:
- There are 4 Elite Lighting Cockatrices in the whole map and their respawn time is 4 minutes.
- You may want to use a Wizard with Levitation Stance to move and kill faster.

Name: I Am An Independent Auch Merchant
Location: City of Auch
NPC: Claire
Reward: Random quality gem.
Details:
1. Place unknown stone in Jewel Crafter machine next to Claire.
2. Return to Claire for reward.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

How to Get:

  • Recruitment Quest

Trigger: Move to Castilla Base 1.
Pre-requisite: [Castilla Episode 1] Completed
Items needed within the quest: 40x Dragonfly Silk, 50x Mega Quartz, 50x Clear Rum, 1x Toungue of the Merman Eater (quest drop)
  1. Talk to Elisa at Castilla Base 1.
  2. Talk to Elisa again.
  3. Move to these places and talk to the people at the coordinates:
  4. - Girl at Auch F/G9
  5. - Woman at Reboldoeux G8
  6. - Dean at Viron G8
  7. - Move to Viron H10
  8. - Woman at Auch I6.
  9. Move back to Castilla and talk to Elisa to finish the task.
  10. Talk to Elisa. She will ask you to collect 40x Dragonfly Silk from Bigfoot (1 in 21) and/or Elite Bigfoot (1 in 10) in the Snowfield of the Ice Wizard-map. Return to her with the items when done.
  11. Talk to Elisa.
  12. Talk to Elisa again. She will ask you to collect 50x Mega Quartz (available in various missions), 50x Clear Rum (Drops in Zeia/Errac and Culverts) and Toungue of the Merman Eater (quest item gotten by killing the boss in Toubkal Mines Bounty Hunter Mission, 100% drop).
  13. Return to Elisa with the items to receive "Character card - Elisa" and "Stance Book - Therapy".


Credits: Recruitment Quest copied (with permission) from M0zz Blogspot

item.title: Char V2
item.author: Leucesios-kun
item.description:
Ever wondered where to put your extra stat point upon promotion to Veteran or Expert? Just check the guide below as to where best to put that new point in. Generally if the character does Melee, points go in Strength. Magic, points go in Int. Ranged combat, Dex. It's the hybrids that cause problems or special cases like Alejandro. Keep in mind that these are suggestions for min/max. If you've got other suggestions feel free to edit or to create a thread below the page.


With regard to the speed cap
If you guys will notice, this guide suggests placing emphasis on Str for fast characters. The reason is all pretty much the same. With buffs and good gear, the benefits of speed from Agi points are pretty much eliminated and end up being a waste. Though some characters benefit with Evade and Block, the perks of going Dex or Str pretty much outweigh placing surplus points in Agi. Don't worry about the .5 additional damage Agi gives. Concentrating on the character's primary damage stat is in most cases better. Whenever in PvP or fighting bosses, you'll be spamming skills. A good attack speed will only come into factor during the short period where your skills will be cooling down. And during such, part of that period is to recover SP by hitting the enemy normally. However, you can get pass SP recovery through potion spam and simply use all the skills in your allotment instead. And frankly if you'll only get a couple of blows in during the down period between skills, its best to make these count through extra damage and critical hits. There are exceptions though, such as Brunie whirling through Outrage.

Speed admittedly looks great but usually factors the most during AFK. And even then, outside the AA or SA, the spawns usually won't really be fast enough for the quick kill to matter. Get it into your head guys, achieving max speed easily is great but in most cases, doing so means you could do a lot more damage by putting your points in Str or Dex since you'll be fighting with buffs that will allow you to cap anyway.

BTW, formula for max attack speed is as follows: 40 divided by the number of attacks a stance does per cycle. For example, Outrage hits 4 times per attack, hence, 40/4 = max speed = 10. Martial Elements: Wind strikes 3 times, hence 40/3 = 13. Low Guard strikes twice hence, 40/2 = 20. Targan Shot hits once hence 40/1 = 40.

In other words, 4 hits per strike = max speed = 10. 3 hits per strike = 13. 2 hits per strike = 20. 1 hit per strike = 40.

As for how much speed exactly 10 points in Agi brings, that's still being debated over/figured out in the official forums and part of it is stance dependent. But generally, 70 Agi can reach respectable speeds with good gear and 80 Agi can reach max speed without too much trouble.

With regard to Agi for damage
Patch 3.0 added an additional .5 damage for every point of Agi above 50. Hence if a character has a Str of 70 and Agi of 70, his damage modifier would be equivalent be 2+1. As Agi governs Attack Speed, Block or Evade and some damage, in some cases, adding Agi would be more beneficial than the character's primary damage modifier stat (Str or Dex). Views upon the benefits that this brings are mixed. However, as we tend to mix and max, its still usually better to place emphasis on the primary stat. For instance, although Agi would make the Musketeer shoot faster, Dex still gives more damage, Accuracy and Criticals.

However, its best to take the stance and character into consideration. Generally, its not a bad idea to take idea if you don't mind losing out in damage as long as you can get the FULL benefits of that Agi can provide.

For example, although Lisa gets Evade in Arnis, she's still really fast and placing points in Agi, although giving you some damage and Evade, you'll miss out in the bonus Attack Speed since she'll cap it without points in Agi only. Take the same situation with Soho however, and the situation might become a bit different, since Soho is slower than Lisa to begin with (not counting buffs). Another example would be Grenmah in Hanging Guard. Placing Agi would be useless since Hanging Guard is going to be slow no matter what, and since it provides no block and possess a lot of usable skills, going full Str would be a better idea.

So, if you're deciding to put points in Agi, always consider the following:
  • Stance
    • Does the stance allow Block or Evasion?
    • Does the stance allow for skill spam or must it also rely on Attack Speed? For example, Flintlock has only 1 main damage dealing skill, namely Accuracy Shot (and perhaps Swift but you'll need to spam Soul Fillers in most cases if you use it), while Hanging Guard can cycle between 3 skills or so (definitely needing Soul Fillers).
    • Will the stance be the sole stance the character uses? For instance, although Nar will be likely using Combatant at Vet and pre-vet which provides Block, and Semi-Lunar at Expert doesn't provide a Block bonus. Another example is Selva, who only has 1 of 2 Vet stances providing Block. Will you rely on her rapier or long sword? Or how about Mia, will you just use Rapiere or will you switch to the Glacier stances too?
  • Character
    • Check the character's stats. Will the character be able to max Attack Speed?
    • What is the character for? For example, everyone uses Claude for pure damage hence we pump his points in Str, despite Mighty Cruz. A Coimbra Trooper tanks, hence Con.
    • Check the character's flaws. For example, although the Auch Infantry can use leather armor, they're really slow with Agi 5.

Master
As for where to allot points in Master, consider two things. First is whether you simply want to further increase damage. In such a case, simply continue pumping points in the character's damage stat, or in case it's already full, pump it in Agi. You'll still want to consider Speed cap though. Second, is whether you just want to make your character tougher. A lot of players are already capable of soloing bosses(say V and KoC) with their current damage output. If you can already breeze through UT solo, you might want to consider pumping points into Con instead. It will lessen your damage potential but if its already really high anyway, points in Con will allow for a greater margin of error or extra HP for survival in both PvE and PvP. This is exceptionally helpful if your character sometimes dies from certain attacks, say Lava Leaf's AoEs, but sometimes are able to pot enough to survive.

Dex? Well Dex for non-ranged characters is feasible but its been argued that its better to simply increase your max damage instead of Accuracy in most cases. You will get a greater chance of Crits from points in Dex though.


Stock Characters
  • Fighter
    • Str - For general purpose or DPS. Veteran, Expert, Master.
    • Con - For tanking. Veteran, Expert, Master.
  • Elementalist
    • Int - Veteran, Expert, and Master
    • Con - For survivability
  • Musketeer
    • Dex - Veteran, Expert, and Master
    • Con - for survivability (note that it won't change a lot).
  • Scout
    • Int - Increases Healing and Resistances. Vet, Expert, Master.
    • Con - For PvE and PvP. Vet, Expert, Master. Great in conjunction with Arnis.
    • Agi - At Vet and/or Expert. The Scout gets Evasion benefits in Arnis and can be deadly with Paralysis when tanking but seriously, try Con instead. (note: speed is capped easily on Arnis)
    • No need for points in Str. Even if you're planning on using Arnis. The Scout will be lousy DPS anyway and will do fine without the extra points, spamming Paralysis skills instead.
  • Wizard
    • Int - Veteran, Expert and Master
    • Con - More survivability, useful both in PvE and PvP situations. As Wizards are mainly debuffers. Vet, Expert, Master.

UPCs
  • Andre
    • Str - Veteran, Expert and Master.
    • Agi - Vet or Expert. Rapiere is fast and has Block. Technically Agi is a bit feasible but Str is still better.
    • Remember, Andre is pretty fantastique with Rapiere. He has 10 Str, Punto (which the Barons lack) and 7 Con.
  • Adelina & Adelina the Pirate -
    • Str - Veteran, Expert and Master. She speed caps easily.
    • Adelina is NOT a pistol user due to her low Dex and lack of Vet pistol stances. Further, at Vet and above you'll be eschewing Heaven and Hell for Low Guard anyway.
    • Placing points in Agi is a waste. Her duality is of no use and the extra speed which she gets is useless since you can achieve near max speed with a decent weapon and a decent pair of gloves. With buffs, you'll likely speed cap. This means that you'll really receive no benefit aside from a slight increase in damage. Remember that Adelina is no tank and gets no benefit from Agi for Block or Evade (except for the pistols stances which are again, useless). As such, you'll get more benefit by placing points in Str and Dex, where she'll receive bonuses in Critical, Accuracy and damage. And again, for as she's no pistol user, the best option is Str.
  • Adriana*

  • Angie
    • Dex - Veteran, Expert and Master. Dex increases her Construction effectiveness and even if you use her in CW or PvP, her starting Con will easily 1HKO her.
    • Con - Veteran, Expert and Master. An increased Con score will aid you take attacks and allow you to survive long enough to put pressure on your opposing Clan's Colonies.
  • Ania Str - Veteran, Expert and Master. Pretty much the speed cap argument again. Just think of her as Lisa on steriods and hence, we can probably ignore Gorgeous' Block.
  • Alejandro
    • Str - Veteran, Expert, and Master to increase damage.
    • Agi - Alternatively, if you're going to Expert him, it might be a good idea to put a point in Agi and then use a Memoir later. He'll be too slow to clear out an area in the AA by himself.
    • Con - At Vet for PvP or at Expert and Master once you've placed points in Str.
  • Asoka Str at Veteran, Expert, and Master. Her stances are all melee stances and will benefit from points in Str.
  • Auch Infantry
    • Dex - Veteran, Expert and Master.
    • Agi - Veteran or Expert. If you want a unique Flintlock user, consider a point in Agi. Flintlock has few spammable skills and also relies on normal attacks for good damage, at 5 starting Agi, you'll need a boost.
  • Baek Ho
    • Str - Veteran, Expert and Master. He starts fast and in PvP, hit the guy first and hit him hard and you'll win.
    • Agi - Probably not a good idea despite Martial Arts Compendium. In PvP, whoever hits first and hard tends to win anyway.

  • Barrol*
    • a

  • Beatrice*

  • Brunie - Dex - Veteran, Expert and Master. Brunie speed caps easily and needs all the Accuracy she can get. Slapping points in Agi leads to a waste in Attack Speed and greatly reduces your Damage and Accuracy.
  • Catherine the Summoner - Cha - Veteran, Expert and Master. Increases doll damage.
  • Catherine of X
    • Just put all points into your Catherine's stat of choice, although all Strength, Dexterity or Intelligence Caths might benefit from 10 point of Agi, specially an Intelligence Cath.
  • Catherine Torsche
    • Veteran, Expert and Master. Catherine's agility is high enough already and adding more to it is a bit of a waste.
    • Con at either Vet, Expert OR Master. Catherine is very good in PVP and with higher lvl armours becoming available and her evasion rate on her Expert stance, Con is a viable alternative.
  • Coimbra Trooper
    • Con - Veteran, Expert and Master. You only want a Trooper for tanking.
    • Agi - At Vet and/or Expert. If you want to speed up getting to Expert though, a point in Agi might be worth it. You don't have to Memoir the point either as Agi increases his Block too.
  • Claude - Str - Veteran, Expert, and Master.
  • Claire
    • Str -Both at Vet, Expert and Master. If you're planning on using Great Swords.
    • Dex - Both at Vet, Expert and Master. If you're planning on using Cannons, which by the way, will get an Expert stance in a future patch. Dex provides a benefit for both of her Expert stances.
    • 7 Agi is already enough to keep her duality but adding points will increase damage in Cannons and Great Swords.
  • Calypso
    • Dex -Both at Vet, Expert and Master. Where does Caly own? PvP. What do you use in PvP? A crossbow.
    • Agi - Only at Vet - Alternatively, you can choose to put a point in Agi to speed her to Expert as it helps both her Daggers and Crossbow stances. She'll still get max Accuracy due to her buffs.
  • Emilia and Emilia the Sage - Int - Increases Healing and Resistances. Both at Vet, Expert and Master. Thinking of Con? Don't bother. She'll get 1HKO-ed in PvP anyway.
  • Eduardo and Kurt
    • Str - Both at Vet, Expert and Master. The Barons excel in dealing damage. Go all out with Str for Rapiere. Agi, like Andre, though feasible, isn't really recommended as they're already fast enough for their Expert Stance (which unfortunately has Grim Soul).
    • Con - At Vet or Expert to increase PvP survivability though going with Str is still a better option.

  • Eba Sharon*

  • Grandice*

  • Garcia
    • Str - At Vet and/or Expert. If you plan on using him as a hybrid.
    • Agi - At Vet and/or Expert. If you plan on using him as a hybrid.
    • Dex - Both at Vet, Expert and Master. If you plan on focusing on Pistols. He would be the only Sight Shot / Outrage user that can wear leather armor..
    • Probably best to add a point in Agi at Vet, and then Str at Expert. Garcia is best as a hybrid and adding the points in Str and Agi will aid him more than putting points in Dex.
    • Note that Avant Guard benefits from Str, Agi and Dex. However, you'll still have to choose whether to go Str or Dex.
    • A Dex Garcia is a moderately armored pistol user, he'll be able to use Leather Armor but will have low Damage, Attack Speed and Accuracy. Prior to the 3.0 patch, he can still somewhat catch up to Brunie by spamming skills and potions. Unfortunately, upon arrival of the patch, Brunie's inherent Agi simply blows Garcia away. Still, points in Dex will ALSO add to his Accuracy and Criticals in Rapiere.
    • A Str Garcia gets to take advantage of his Strength in more stances. In addition to this, with 7 Dex, he'll actually have good Crits and Accuracy in Rapiere.
  • Grenmah
    • Str - Veteran, Expert and Master. She already has great Con. Strength will aid her keep aggro along with Provoke. Don't bother putting points in Agi. She has no decent Blocking stances and a Great Sword will be dead slow no matter what you do.
    • To repeat, Grenmah may have a great starting Con but she's same as someone with Stave Guard or Defender. Her lack of Block means she'll only be tanking with DR and Def. This means you'll be cycling between Hanging Guard's skills, an SP potion, and HP potion.

  • Gertrude
    • Str - At Vet and/or Expert/Master. If you insist on using Gertrude, go full Str to take advantage of the MMA stance.
    • Agi - At Vet - A single point in Agi will give him a slight boost in Block, ATK Speed and Damage. If you choose to add a point in Agi, be sure to add to Str upon reaching Expert. At Expert, Martial Arts Compendium provides Evade too.
    • Note however, that placing points in Agi cripples Gert's DPS more when compared to other martial artists. Martial artists allocate points between 3 primary stats, Str, Agi and Con. Since Gert has a Con of 7, his damage is potentially the lowest of all the MAs, though he can remain standing after taking a good amount of damage.
  • Grace
    • Dex - Veteran. Expert, and Master
    • Don't bother with Con, she's still a coat user afterall, will be a easy 1hit even with 10 Dex 6 Con.
  • Gracielo
    • Str - Veteran, Expert and Master.
    • Agi? No! Although possessing the same speed as Baek Ho, Gracielo has the advantage of getting bonus Attack Speed through his self buff, Raging Wind. In addition to this, Martial Arts Compendium's Enhanced Lion Heart increases Attack Speed, among others, too.
  • Hellena
    • Int - At Veteran, Expert, and Master. You might as well make her do what she does best.
    • Con - For survivability
  • Idge and Battlesmith Idge
    • Str - Veteran, Expert and Master. Great Sword stances will be slow no matter what you do and even you can near max Mighty Cruz's speed without putting points in Agi. As for Hanging Guard, you'll want Str for that.
    • Accuracy problems? Grab Aiming Gloves.
  • Irawain
    • Str - At both Vet and Expert. You've got 50 Con and Leather Armor. Strike first, strike hard.
    • Agi - At Vet. MA: Fire benefits from Agi due to Block and putting a point in Agi puts him with the same stats as Baek and makes Irawain level faster. As for Martial Arts Compendium, Irawain might actually benefit but remember that Irawain has a starting Str of 8. An Expert Irawain can likely be really deadly with a Str of 10!
    • At Master, go with either 1 more Con or Agi, either can be nice.
  • Jack - Dex - Veteran, Expert and Master. Aids his construction skill and you won't be using him anywhere else aside from power leveling.
  • Jose - Dex - Veteran, Expert and Master. Poor Jose's lousy with Melee no matter what you do. It'll be painful getting him to Expert and no matter what, and you might as well save yourself a Memoir and go full Dex to improve his Cannons which will later get an Expert stance.
  • Lionel* - Dex - Veteran, Expert and Master.
  • Lisa - Str - Veteran, Expert and Master. Don't waste points in Agi. Lisa is inherently fast and can hit the Attack Speed cap easily. At Vet, you'll likely be using Raid Assault which will benefit from Block but without a shield, don't expect to tank. With Arnis, she gets Evade and gets to take strike really fast between skills. Still though, wastage is wastage. Go Str.
  • Lorch
    • Dex - Veteran, Expert, and Master.
    • Agi - At Vet - If you're only going to use him to power level or farm, you might as well make him shoot fast. If you wanted DPS you'd be using Grace anyway.
  • Mia
    • Int - Both at Vet, Expert and Master. If you plan on using her for raids, more specifically Fire Gate as an inferior Elementalist.
    • Str - Both at Vet, Expert and Master. If you want to keep her as a hybrid or for Rapiere with a few extra tricks up her sleeve.
    • Don't bother with Agi. It won't help her duality and Mia certainly isn't a tank.
  • M'boma
    • Int - Veteran, Expert and Master.
    • Con - At Vet and/or Expert. A single point in Con will aid M'boma for PvP.
  • Najib
    • Dex - Veteran, Expert and Master, if you're planning on using Flintlock.
    • Agi - At Veteran in order to keep his duality, although you might want to note that you'll have trouble getting good Accuracy at 8 Dex. He'll still do decently in Low Guard though.
    • Str - At Veteran and/or Expert - If you're planning on using Low Guard. You can also put a point in Agi should you choose to add in Strength. He's already better than a Fighter with Sabers to begin with.
  • Nar
    • Str - Vet, Expert, and Master for DPS.
    • Agi - At Vet if you're leveling him to Expert to turn traps off in Occulta. Speeds up the leveling process. Seriously though, what a waste. His Expert stance is purely offensive too.
    • Con - At Master.
  • Panfilo and Panfilo the Iron Chef
    • Str - Both at Vet, Expert and Master. He doesn't really have any tanking stance as he can't equip a Shield. You might as well max him out for Low Guard or Flame Guard for PvP annoyance (Fireball won't kill anyone but it'll knock em down).
    • Agi - At Vet, as a slight boost in Speed will help him level and should you use Hack and Slash, adds some Block. Seriously though, you wont' be using Hack and Slash at Vet or above. Better to go all out Strength.
    • Don't go with Int. It won't really help him as his Int starts out too low as compared to Mia.
  • Raven
    • Str - If you plan on using Raven as a Tank/DPS by prioritising him in Rapiere, Str is the way to go.
    • Dex - Croisements attacks use the pistol as the default weapon, so increasing Dex will increase the damage of normal attacks.
    • Agi - At Vet only! -If you want to keep Ravens duality increasing the agility by 10 Maximum will help him increase his speed in the stances. Any more than 10 points on Agi is a waste though.
  • Reckless Emilia
    • Int - Veteran, Expert, and Master.
    • Cha - At Expert and Master - Will increase the effectiveness of her skills. (?)
  • Rescue Knight
    • Dex - Both at Vet, Expert and Master. If you're planning on using Flintlock. Best to just use Aiming Gloves though.
    • Con - Both at Vet, Expert and Master, if you plan on using the Rescue Knight as a budget Romina, mainly there for being an armored rezzer.
    • Agi - At Vet or Expert. If you want to keep her duality. Aids her Block, ATK Speed and adds some slight DPS to all her stances. Note that the Rescue Knight DOESN'T have Equites.
  • Reboldeaux Soldier
    • Str - For general purpose or DPS. Veteran, Expert and Master.
    • Con - For tanking. Veteran, Expert and Master.
  • Romina
    • Dex - Veteran, Expert and Master. If you're planning on using Flintlock. Improves Accuracy for Equites as well but if you're planning on using Equites primarily, you'll still get more benefit from Str. If you want Accuracy, try using Aiming Gloves.
    • Str - Veteran, Expert and Master. If you're planning on using Equites. Keep all points in Str. She's the best Equites user out there.
    • Agi - At Vet and/or Expert. Improves Block, ATK Speed and adds some slight DPS, keeps her duality. Also, maxing Block with Romina can make her a terror in PvP. Armored rez with high Def and Block and still able to slay characters using Equites makes her a match breaker.
  • Ramiro -
    • Str - Veteran, Expert and Master.
    • Agi? Nope. Sure the kids are fast but can you use their speed in Hanging Guard? Nope.
  • Selva - Str - Veteran, Expert and Master. Her Rapida Espada stance has Block, and with the AR potential her Arm Guard brings, you might as well go all out offense. If you do plan on using Rapida Espada, Agi is actually a feasible choice.
  • Soho and Soho the Fighter
    • Str - Both at Vet, Expert and Master. Don't bother with Int. His Healing sucks anyway and his buffs won't really be affected.
    • Dex? Again Soho is no healer. However, Soho the Fighter has a high Critical rate as compared to other Martial Artists due to his stat allocation of Str 6, Agi 7, Con 5 and Dex 6, whereas all the other MAs allocates points only between Str, Agi and Con, ignoring Dex.
    • Agi? Though he gets Evade in Martial Arts Compendium Soho will likely still be better off with Str as he can buff through Bard anyway.
  • Soso - Str - Veteran, Expert and Master. Don't put points in Agi. She'll Speed Cap easily.
  • Tiburon
    • Str - Veteran, Expert and Master.
    • Agi? Nope. Same argument as Ramiro.
  • Valleria
    • INT - Both at Vet and Expert. Higher HP amounts in healing skills and stronger damage from Exclusion
    • CON - At Master.
  • Viki - Cha - Both at Vet, Expert and Master. Viki is no Healer and you'll mainly be using him to power level so go full Cha which improves his summons, you could otherwise get Con, it would help making Viki less lame.
  • Vincent - Int - Both at Vet and Expert. Don't bother with Con before Master even for CW. You'll get trampled over and your mandolin will be smashed over your head no matter what.
  • Yeganeh
    • Dex - Improves his Construction skills.
    • Con - If you plan on using Yeganeh in CW, putting all your points in Con might keep you alive long enough for your structures to be annoying. Note that its all points in Con or none at all. Actually this is highly controversial and debatable but heck, it'd be interesting, at least until an Ele AoE blasts your structures anyway.

item.title: Wiki Of The New World
item.author: chikodaniel
item.description:
Welcome to Wiki Of The New World, a fan-made wiki of the massively multiplayer online game Granado Espada Online (formerly known as Sword 2 and Sword of the New World: Granado Espada), licensed in North America by T3Fun and Europe by EuroGamez GmbH. Here you'll find info about items, characters, quests, and much more. This wiki, like all wikis, is a nonstop work in progress. We need your help to fill in the wiki. So if you have any information that helps the site, add it. If you find anything about the wiki that you think should be changed but don't have the privileges to change (i.e. page movement), let us know. Ask before posting a link to off-site guides, etc.

Monday, January 18, 2016

item.title: Game Stances
item.author: chikodaniel
item.description:
Stances are skill sets which include up to 5 skills. There are many stances for all of the characters (Stock / UPC); some of them are broadly available to most characters in the specific class, some of them are unique to one character, and others are modified versions of other stances! This is a table that lists all of the stances, and also provides information at the bottom of the table.

Notes:
  1. Names highlighted in green means that they are modified stances that were made to fit certain characters. For example, Standing Shot and Targan Shot are basically one and the same. However, Targan Shot replaces Standing Shot's skill "Blinding Shot" with "Bayonet Assault".
  2. Names highlighted in light blue are stances that only one particular UPC can use. For instance, Valleria is the only character that can use Innocentio. And Selva Norte is the only character that can use Cauchemar or Rapida Espada
  3. Martial Artist stances are only used by the 5 Martial Artists: Baek Ho, Soso, Irawain, Gracielo, and Detective Gertrude. (excluding Soho The Fighter)
  4. Information regarding stances are located at the bottom of the stance table.

Skill Points
Maxing a Stance fully to Level 25 gives 79 total points to distribute amongst your skills for that stance.
You will be able to max all skills in stances with 3~4 skills.
You will not be able to max all skills in stances with 5 skills, so be careful in choosing which skill you want to leave unmaxed.

Stance Level 1 gets 0 points per level
Stance Levels 2-4 get 1 point per level.
Stance Levels 5-9 get 2 points per level.
Stance Levels 10-14 get 3 points per level.
Stance Levels 15-19 get 4 points per level.
Stance Levels 20-24 get 5 points per level.
Stance Level 25 gets 6 points per level.

Reset Skillpoints option: New Cash Shop Item Exercise Book for Skills - will reset the skill points for all skills in all stances for the selected leader character.
Veteran Stance Acquirement
You can learn Veteran stances upon promoting yourself to Veteran. An Awakening is not acquired to learn the stances, only the promotion (using Shiny Crystals). All Veteran stances can be purchased from Master Guardian NPC (Located in City of Auch)for 1,000,000 vis each
Expert Stance Acquirement
Expert Stances, like Veteran stances, are only learn-able when you've promoted yourself to Expert. However, you cannot just "buy" Expert stance manuals; instead - you are tasked with having to complete a rather difficult quest/questline in order to gain the ability to acquire these stances. The Errac Questline is the series of quests that must be completed. Once you complete these quests, Emilia (in Port of Coimbra) will then allow you to trade 3 Great Stones + a Constellation Symbol (depending on what stance it is) for the stance manual. See This List for more in-depth details on Expert Stances. Do note, that some Expert Stances are acquired in different ways. Hapkido is gained by completing This Questline and giving Gertrude the Great Stones+Symbol. Innocentio is gained as a random drop from the Roulette chest from the Joaquin Prison Raid. Vincent Rio's Serenade is gained by completing This Questline. While Gorgeous and Waxing are obtained from the Feso Shop for 850,000 Feso. But the rest are all from Emilia. Hapkido, Prelude, and Sect of Moonlight are now available in the Feso shop for 1,500,000 Feso, 1,000,000 feso, and 1,000,0000 feso respectively.

item.title: PvP
item.author: chikodaniel
item.description:
PvP (literally, "player versus player") refers to competitive play, or direct combat between families.Granado Espada has a number of different PvP modes to choose from, with enough variety to keep those who prefer PvP to grind interested. Here are some summaries on the various pvp modes available in-game. More detailed guides are available on sub-pages within this section, feel free to add pvp tips too.

PvP Rooms

Each town has a PvP Officer, who can host pvp matches on a variety of maps. This is the primary way to have small-scale friendly pvp: invite your friends to the PvP Officer in a town, and play against one another.

Duels

Duels are one-on-one matches that count for Ladder points (visible on your Family Profile, Alt+R). There are two kinds of duels, depending where they are initiated. If initiated in town, when a duel is accepted you and your adversary will be teleported to an instance where you can fight one on one. If initiated in any map zone, the two families will become hostile right where they stand until one of them is defeated (wiped out).

Baron Mode (PK)

Baron Mode is Player Killing. This mode of PvP does not have to be accepted by a target family. Baron mode is available for families on PK servers (currently Bristia and Illier in SotNW) after they reach Family Level 5. Barons appear hostile to all other players, including their clanmates. Baron PKing causes Exp loss to characters that are killed, however, Baron families lose more exp than their targets and also drop an item upon death.

Barons cannot enter Secret Areas. Baron mode cannot be declared in mission rooms, Faction Fight, or PvP Raids.

La Tierra de La Sed

In La Tierra De La Sed, families who belong to a faction affiliation different from your own will appear hostile to you here. This means that if you belong to a Royalist clan, any family that does not belong to a Royalist clan will appear as hostile.

At 21:00 there is a mini colony war in the La Tierra De La Sed zone in which each faction may attempt to claim the majority of the 11 colonies that appear on the map. This war lasts for tirthy minutes and the winner is granted with 24 Hours Lvl 2:Tierra De La Sed buff.Note that unlike true Colony War, Valkyrie Crashers cannot be used here for colony damage.

Fire Isle

Fire Isle is primarily a farming zone, but with extremely tight space and universal hostility outside of squads.

Faction War

When two Clans are at war.all members of these clans will appear hostile to one another on all maps except in Secret Areas.

Colony War

Colony War (CW) is Granado espada server-wide mass PvP event. It occurs once weekly and lasts two hours. During this time, Colonies in 16 area maps are able to be assaulted and conquered by clans,You can only attack clans that were register for CW (15 mins before CW start)

World-Cross-PvP

The X World PVP server will allow users from other servers to challenge each other to the ultimate dual and for once and for all decide who the greatest PVP Warrior is.

item.title: New Vis Making Guide
item.author: chikodaniel
item.description:
Since the old guide is outdated (it was made for SOTNW in 2010, I thought it was about time to share the secrets to making vis in the current version of Granado Espada

The Best way for get vis,is the Clock Tower path!

1. Daily Instanced Raids

  • Castilla Mines
    Drops: Enchantment Chips Lv 100 and Veteran, Ancient Relic Piece, Gold Relic Piece, roulette.
    How to get there: talk to Castilla Exploration Recruit Soldier in Port of Coimbra. Enter the mine at H-3.
    Recommended level: Expert+ if you want to do it fast.

    Most people solo Castilla Mines up until Basilisk (OHKO's at 10% HP left; unless you can freeze/stun it).
    Also killing the normal monsters will yield quite a few "Ancient Relic Piece".
    You can enter the mines for free once each day (resets at 12am SST). You can re-enter the mines more than once a day and keep farming for Enchantment Chips but it will require "Ancient Relic" upon entry. You can get Ancient Relic by exchanging 3x "Ancient Relic Piece" and 3,000 Feso in the Relic Exchanger (E-2 Castilla Garrison).

    The Relic Exchanger is also a great way to try your luck at gaining rare items like the Dragon Heart Recipe, Necklace Recipes and so on. So be sure to collect Ancient Relic Pieces whenever possible!


  • Dr. Torsche's Hidden Basement
    Drops: Enchantment Chip Veteran, Gold Bar, Roulette.

  • Bounty Hunter Guild
    Drops: Enchantment chips, Roulette.

  • Instanced Rafflesia
    Drops: Level 100 gears, Necklace recipes, Elite 84 Armors, Chance of Constellation Box.

  • Instanced Sharffenberger
    Drops: Level 100 gears, Necklace recipes, Elite Schvarlier Piece, Hilt of Elite Weapons, Chance of Constellation Box.


2. Use a Pet
If you buy some gold and don't want to waste it on selling cash shop items for fast vis, then do the next best thing: buy feso, get a pet, and use it when you AFK level.

Great places to AFK (in no particular order):
  • Citadel of the Gods (Caebolan SA/AA) - Red/green/blue rough-stone, Magic-spelled Amethyst, Liquid Gas, Veteran Gloves and Boots [cash shop map]
  • Bahamar Ancient Cave - Snail Shell, Old Chess Piece, Red/green/blue rough-stone, Level 100 gear [cash shop map]
  • Skeleton Ancient Area - Red/green/blue rough-stone [cash shop map]
  • Katovic Snowfield - Cabbage, Golden Apple, Mega Ionium, Outlaw's Cigar (alchemy rating 3), Peace Insignia (alchemy rating 3), A Marksman's Magic Bullet (alchemy rating 3)
  • Errac Tierra, Dias or Noche - Rhodolite, Ancient Rune - Te, Ti, Ar, An
  • Viron, Red Sunset Forest - Letizia Shiny Box, Piece of Naraka - Ma, Mo, Lu, Beel, Al, Than, He.
  • Rion Dungeon Corridor - Shiny Crystal
  • Prison de Joaquin, Torture Chamber - Shiny Crystal
  • Ustiur, Zona Uno - Red/green/yellow Leaf of Rafflesia, Dragon Leather, Shiny Crystal
  • Dr. Torshe's Mansion - Catherine body parts, Strange items (alchemy rating 2), Otite Pieces
  • Viron Forest Maps - Letizia Shiny Boxes,Devils Dreams
These common loots you acquire by AFKing are very valuable:
  • Level 80-92 gears - convert into chips with the Chip Exchanger to sell on the market.
  • Level 100 gears - break into chips, if it doesn't break at +6, go make a Level 32 crystal at El Dorado and sell.
  • Shiny Crystals - needed for a lot of things now: keys, Bounty Hunter missions, socketing, crafting.
  • Rough-stones - drag them into the Jewel Crafter. Then try your luck at the Jewel Exchanger and hope for a High Quality Spoumene and High Quality Obsidian. (Most people like to exchange jewels that come from blue or green rough-stones).
You can make tons of vis this way if you are a dedicated AFK leveler.

3. Clan Raid Missions
These missions are known as:
  • Sharffenberger the Cursed
  • Mad Rafflesia
  • Mad Uraeus
  • Mad Griffon
  • Madness Farm
  • Curse of the Red Sunset Forest
These missions are instanced and done once per week. Each mission will give Reward box roulette(s) during or at the end of the mission. There is a lot of potential to get Dragon Heart Recipes, Elite Le Blanc Recipes, Constellation Symbol Boxes, and Pieces of Naraka (which are needed for Stratavista Demon series weapons - 35 AR base). This of course requires you to join a clan (a fairly active or large clan will be helpful in completing these missions).

4. Alejandro's Boat Quest
If you have completed the pequod boat quest (Viron) you can speak to the Wharf Manager (E-9) and request to support local or foreign merchants.
In this trade you will need Pure Talt/Etretanium/Ionium/Quartz/Aidanium.
You can trade either with Home Merchants (more costly but chance for greater rewards) or Foreign Merchants (less costly but worse rewards).
Always choose to trade with Home Merchants!
Possible Rewards: Vis (from 1-5 mill) or Shiny Crystal Box (from 1-9 boxes and each can yield 1-500 Shiny Crystals).


5. Sell Cash Shop items
Sword 2 may be Free2Play but if you really want an advantage, you're going to have to spend some money on this game. The best items to sell depend on the server you're playing on and the economy at the time. They will fluctuate. But as a general rule, the most popular items to sell are enchant boosters, upgrade accelerators, soul crystals, and mysterious powders. Sometimes Lacquers may be worth selling. With the new update Mercenary Warrants are no longer tradeable. Avoid trying to sell the lesser used cash shop items like Vet Memoirs unless you know there is a buyer who is looking for it.

6. Buy Low and Sell High on the Marketplace
If you see people selling in-demand items for cheap, buy them all! Then resell them. This is a basic money making strategy that exists in life.

These are the four guaranteed vis making strategies. Two of them require you to be a paying customer. The other two can be done relatively easy now, as the economy has some what dumped recently. Things are selling on the Market Manager for way cheaper than before. To buy low and sell high also requires patients, but remember, if done correctly this can net you around 30mil a week. You do not need to spend real money to get far in SotNW anymore, as cash shop items have become cheap, and easily accessible. Some items will help you get to Master a lot faster than normal, but if you are willing to invest more than a month in Sword 2, you will be able to have multiple vets and experts in a reasonable time.

7. Test Your Luck
If a certain item for example a 92e armor will sell for 50m normally but will sell for 150m with 3dr, you could try to enchant it to test your luck. Weapons are typically easier to enchant due to the different stats you could potentially go for such as racial mods. In servers where the enchantment chip prices are low, it is less risky.

8. Tiburon Game
With chips worth exponentially higher at the next tier such as 88-92 and 96-100 you could make a profit gambling them with Tiburon. Since 88 will degrade to 84 and 96 will degrade to 92, you will lose the least amount of profit if a gamble goes wrong. Of course it depends on the market prices. But remember, it is possible to completely loose the chips, be sure to look up a Tiburon game faq or guide, as this will help you avoid loosing precious chips.

9.Vieron Clock Tower
If you are a new player,and you dont really know what to do to get nice ammounts of Vis,or you know but dont have the properly Gear.
You can always go the cheap way and Join Clock Tower as Buffer (Rio,Lorch,Bernelli,Karjalain)
All you need is get some millions and buy 2 Rings of Hound,Infiltrator,Serenade/Prelude or Boost Magic,then just wait till someone do CT and Join!!
You can easy get arround 100-200m daily if you lucky Enough to get nice items on roulettes
on Weekends extra roulette (5m Roulette) doubles the item you obtain!!

item.title: Game Characters
item.author: chikodaniel
item.description:
Looking for something in particular?
Character Related:

 Character Promotion
Character Attributes
Character Trading
Character Comparison
Character Specific Skills: Inherent Skill List
Status Effect Related: Status Effects List
Stat Point Related: Points at Vet, Expert and Master
Stance Related: Stances
Expert Stances
Miscellaneous: Class Combinations
Class Guides
Combination Buffs
There are a large variety of different characters that are available for your use in Sword 2. These characters
can be categorized in two groups: the stock characters and the UPCs (unique playable characters).

Stock characters are available upon creation of a family and are the "basic"classes most often seen in
MMOs; they specialize in a wide range of skills. These characters do not require a card to be made and
duplicates can be created at your discretion.

UPCs are specialists who excel in their own specific field, and in some cases, are hybrids. Unlike stocks,
they must be earned through quests and are gained by obtaining their card. Consequently, they can only
be made once through the consumption of their character card.

While these classes are versatile enough to be possibly used effectively no matter the combination,
new players may find the recommended starting teams page helpful.

—————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————
Stock Characters ...
Stock characters are available to all players at any time. A player can make an unlimited amount of these, provided
they have room in their quarters. For additional information to influence your choice, review the class guide page.
Fighter
 Scout
 Wizard
 Musketeer
 Elementalist

—————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————

UPC stands for unique playable character. Aside from playing with stock characters (listed above), you can also earn other characters to use.
UPCs are most commonly acquired through completing specific quest for them. You'll find these UPCs as NPCs throughout the various towns within the game, and most of them have questlines and will give your their Character Card once completed. To create a UPC with a character card, keep that specific character card in your inventory, then log out to the Barracks (Quarters) and select Create A Character. In the drop-down list for Class, their unique character will be available for creation. All you have to do is name them and voila! They are a part of your family.

The vast majority of UPCs use the stock classes as foundations for their design. There are two kinds of UPC that are most common, what are referred to as "Hybrid" or "Specialized." An example of a specialized UPC is Brunie Etienne, who is considered a musketeer, but specializes specifically in pistols. In her case, she is considered superior with pistol stances, but is completely unable to use anything else, while the stock musketeer uses rifles and bayonets as well as pistols. In other cases, there are characters like M'Boma, who are hybrids between two stock classes. M'Boma himself can use select wizard stances as well as fire elementalist stances.

Super-Promo UPCs
Super Promo UPCs cannot be acquired through conventional means (e.g., quests). In the past, these character cards (save for Asoka's) have been
a rare drop in Mystery Boxes, which were obtained from events. G1 has also run promotions on their website with the character cards available as prizes.
Keep an eye out on the forums for these promotions and take advantage of them, or perhaps find a player who would be willing to sell them to you.

RECRUITMENT QUEST

  2. Talk to Saint Anis in Armonia Cathedral (F3/G3).

    • When the last corrupted monster is dead, you will acquire Warrior's Earrings (quest item).
    • Tip: There is no need for Holy Water of Armonia in this mission.
  4. Talk to Sirius in Armonia Cathedral (F3) to give him the above quest item.
  5. Collect Warrior's Earrings (quest item) x20 by killing Corrupted Guards in Armonia En Celar.
  6. Talk to Sirius in Armonia Cathedral (F3).

Reward: Veteran G EXP Card x5, White Gold Bar x2.

Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. Talk to New Aide Lieut. Albert in Kielce (F2) to start a non-combat mission ("Bristia Government General").
    • Talk to Olivia in mission.
  2. Trigger a combat mission ("Forbidden Rune Spell", 30 minutes) at Bristia Scar (F7).
    • Reduce Breeze to 50% HP.
    • Tip: Breeze appears at a distance, so you can take your time to buff up.
    • Tip: Lure Breeze over to Vincent, so he will help you in the fight.
  3. Talk to Vincent in Viron (E8).
[120] Glorious Sanctuary: Trail (3)
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. Talk to Nameless Person (i.e. Kurt) in Los Toldos. Vincent must be in the team.
    • To enter Los Toldos without becoming a baron, activate Otite Perfume and talk to Mamons in Porto Bello Deserted Quay (E3).
  2. Collect the following quest items by killing the respective monsters of Bounty Hunter's Guild missions.
    • Bone Piece of Boneless (quest item) x1 from Demonic Boneless in Demonic Skeleton Dungeon mission.
    • King of Greed Tooth (quest item) x1 from Demonic King of Greed in Demonic Bahama mission.
    • Cranium of Necro Shaman (quest item) x1 from Demonic Necro Shaman in Demonic Occulta mission.
  3. Talk to Nameless Person in Los Toldos to give him the above quest items. Vincent must be in the team.
  4. Talk to Gerar Loren in Pegadilla. Vincent must be in the team. You can get there from Port of Coimbra (B9).
  5. Talk to Calyce in Pegadilla. Vincent must be in the team.
  6. Kill the following monsters in daily missions.
    • Gullfaxi x1 in Joaquin Barrier Siege mission.
    • Suburb Gate x1 in Joaquin Barrier Defense mission.
    • Tip: You need fast attackers (e.g. Leonele) to break crystals and gates. See raid guides on the links above.
  7. Collect the following quest items.
    • Tender Arctic Wolf Meat (quest item) x200 - Kill Arctic Wolf in Katovic Snowfield.
    • Barrel Cover of Crown Lloyd (quest item) x200 - Kill Crown Lloyd in Dr. Torsche's Mansion Annex.
  8. Talk to Calyce in Pegadilla to give her the above quest items and to receive Pegadilla Certificate (quest item). Vincent must be in the team.

[120] Glorious Sanctuary: Trace of Van
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: (a) Veteran G EXP Card x5, White Gold Bar x2; (b) Veteran G EXP Card x5, White Gold Bar x2.
  1. Talk to Gerar Loren in Pegadilla to give him Pegadilla Certificate (quest item) and to receive reward (a).
  2. Trigger a quest dialogue at Al Quelt Moreza Nartex (B8). Vincent must be in the team.
  3. Trigger a quest dialogue at Dr. Torsche's Mansion Savage Garden (D2). Vincent must be in the team.
  4. Trigger a quest dialogue at Interna de Bahia (H11). Vincent must be in the team. You must use 1 Amethyst Piece to use the Warp Gate (F4).
  5. Trigger a quest dialogue at Occulta Fortress (F3/G3). Vincent must be in the team. You must use Ancient Rune - Ti, Te, An, and Ar (1 each) to open the gate (D6). The gate stays open for about 10 minutes.
  6. Trigger a quest dialogue at Bahama Heaven's Altar (F3). Vincent must be in the team.
  7. Talk to Vincent in Viron (E8) for reward (b).

[120] Glorious Sanctuary: Be Framed
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: Veteran G EXP Card x5, White Gold Bar x2.
  1. Talk to New Aide Lieut. Albert in Kielce (F2) to start a non-combat mission ("Bristia Government General").
    • Talk to Caisse inside the mission.
    • Talk to Caisse again inside the mission. Vincent must be in the team.
  2. Talk to Vincent in Viron (E8) for reward.
  3. Trigger a combat mission ("Unsought Fight", 30 minutes) in Kielce Laboratory (G5).
    • Kill the 2 Escort Knights. Vincent will help you.
    • Tip: They can inflict [Armor Crash] status.
    • Tip: Let Vincent fight, while you buff up. Then lure one away to kill first.
  4. Talk to Vincent in Viron (E8).

[120] Glorious Sanctuary: The Sky Road of Armonia
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. Talk to Marchetti in Kielce Laboratory (F11) to receive Flying Ship Key (quest item).

[120] Glorious Sanctuary: Anilio
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: Holy Water of Armonia x5.
  1. Talk to Chief Guard Karl in Armonia Anilio (D5) for reward. To go there, talk to Flying Ship Researcher Zeppelin in Kielce Laboratory (F4). The server quest must be completed first.
  2. Talk to Immigration Officer Ramon in Armonia Anilio (D4). Vincent must be in the team.
  3. Trigger a quest dialogue at Armonia Anilio (I5).
  4. Trigger a quest dialogue at Armonia Anilio (K8).
  5. Kill Armonia Bear x100 and Armonia Wolf x100 in Armonia Latina. You can get there via Armonia Anilio (B8).
  6. Trigger a quest dialogue at Armonia Anilio (K8).
  7. Talk to Immigration Officer Ramon in Armonia Anilio (D4) to receive Diplomatic Delegation Certificate (quest item). Vincent must be in the team.


[120] Glorious Sanctuary: The Reality of Armonia
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: Holy Water of Armonia x5, White Gold Bar x2, Veteran G EXP Card x5.
  1. Trigger a combat mission ("He Is Back", 30 minutes) at Cite de Armonia (F7). You can get there via Armonia Anilio (K7).
    • Defeat Crusader Lane and Crusader Lude. Vincent will help you.
    • They can inflict [Armor Crash] status.
  2. Trigger a quest dialogue at Cite de Armonia (C5).
  3. Talk to Flower Seller Susana in Cite de Armonia (H8).
  4. Talk to Art Dealer Ruben in Cite de Armonia (H8).
  5. Talk to Tramp Cesar in Cite de Armonia (F9/F10) to give him White Gold Bar x2.
  6. Talk to Memento Mori Mediator Shuran in Cite de Armonia (I4).
  7. Trigger a combat mission ("Beast Handler", 10 minutes) at Armonia Latina (E7).
    • Reduce Jurgen to 10% HP. Vincent will help you. You do not need to kill Abyss Wolf and Abyss Bear.
    • Tip: Let Vincent tank them, while you buff up. Attack Jurgen and lure him away from the rest.
    • Tip: Abyss Bear has a large area attack skill.
  8. Talk to Memento Mori Mediator Shuran in Cite de Armonia (I4) to receive Ruby Ring of Shuran (quest item).
[120] Glorious Sanctuary: The Cathedral of Light
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: (a) Veteran G EXP Card x5, White Gold Bar x2; (b) Expert G EXP Card x5, White Gold Bar x1, Holy Water of Armonia x5.
  1. Talk to Archbishop Vega in Armonia Cathedral (D4) to give him Ruby Ring of Shuran (quest item). You can get there via Cite de Armonia (F6).
  2. Talk to Sirius in Armonia Cathedral (F3).
  3. Talk to Saint Anis in Armonia Cathedral (F3/G3).
  4. Collect Asphodel (quest item) x20 in Armonia Latina. NPC plants appear randomly on the map. Click on them to drop the item, then loot it.
  5. Talk to Saint Anis in Armonia Cathedral (F3/G3) for reward (a).
  6. Talk to Saint Anis in Armonia Cathedral (F3/G3) to receive Well-Cleaned Asphodel (quest item) x20.
  7. Trigger a quest dialogue in Armonia Cathedral (F3/G3) to give Well-Cleaned Asphodel (quest item) x20.
  8. Talk to Saint Anis in Armonia Cathedral (F3/G3) for reward (b).

[120] Glorious Sanctuary: The Faith of Sirius
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: Expert G EXP Card x5, White Gold Bar x2, Holy Water of Armonia x5.
  1. Talk to Sirius in Armonia Cathedral (F3).
  2. Kill Armonia Bear x100 and Armonia Wolf x100 in Armonia Latina.
  3. Talk to Sirius in Armonia Cathedral (F3).
  4. Collect Ruddy Armonium (quest item) x1 by killing monsters in Armonia Latina.
  5. Talk to Sirius in Armonia Cathedral (F3) to give him the above quest item and to receive reward.

[120] Glorious Sanctuary: Thoughts of Archbishops
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. Talk to Archbishop Vega in Armonia Cathedral (D4).
  2. Talk to Archbishop Lennon in Armonia Cathedral (I4).
  3. Talk to Priest Paulo in Armonia Cathedral (G4).
  4. Talk to Priest Francis in Armonia Cathedral (F4).
  5. Talk to Village Man Martin in Cite de Armonia (F9).
  6. Talk to Flower Seller Susana in Cite de Armonia (H8).
  7. Talk to Millionaire Andres in Cite de Armonia (E9).

[120] Glorious Sanctuary: Where Is The Bread I Left At Dinner Last Night?
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: Expert G EXP Card x5, White Gold Bar x2.
  1. Trigger item acquisition at Armonia Cathedral (F7) to gain Sealed Document (quest item).
  2. Talk to Archbishop Lennon in Armonia Cathedral (I4) for reward.
  3. Talk to Archbishop Vega in Armonia Cathedral (D4) to start a non-combat mission ("Where Is The Bread I Left At Dinner?").
  4. Talk to Sirius in Armonia Cathedral (F3).
  5. Talk to Saint Anis in Armonia Cathedral (F3/G3).

[120] Glorious Sanctuary: Their Duties
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. Talk to Archbishop Vega in Armonia Cathedral (D4) to start a non-combat mission ("Light & Shadow, the Truth of Armonia").

[120] Glorious Sanctuary: Resolution of a Crusader
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: (a) Expert G EXP Card x5, White Gold Bar x2; (b) Holy Water of Armonia x5.
  1. Talk to Sirius in Armonia Cathedral (F3).
  2. Talk to Archbishop Lennon in Armonia Cathedral (I4) for reward (a).
  3. Talk to Sirius in Armonia Cathedral (F3) for reward (b).

[120] Glorious Sanctuary: To The Basement Camp
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: Refined Holy Water of Armonia (expendable item) x5.
  1. Talk to Commander William in Armonia Apostadero (H8). You can get there by talking to Michelan in Cite de Armonia (I4).
  2. Trigger a combat mission ("Cursed Land", 30 minutes) at Armonia En Celar (G7). You can get there via Armonia Apostadero (G10).
    • Let the monsters kill you. The [Curse of Abyss] status should ensure mission failure.
  3. Talk to Commander William in Armonia Apostadero (H8).
  4. Talk to Saint Anis in Armonia Cathedral (F3/G3).
  5. Collect Ruddy Armonium (quest item) x50 by killing monsters in Armonia Latina.
  6. Talk to Saint Anis in Armonia Cathedral (F3/G3) to give her the above quest items. She will give you Refined Holy Water of Armonia (quest item) and the reward.
  7. Talk to Commander William in Armonia Apostadero (H8) to give him Refined Holy Water of Armonia (quest item).
  8. Trigger a combat mission ("Cursed Land", 30 minutes) at Armonia En Celar (G7).
    • Kill all monsters. Sirius will help you.
    • Tip: Use Refined Holy Water of Armonia (expendable item) to remove the [Curse of Abyss] status.
    • Tip: Sirius' normal attacks can inflict [Armor Crash] status, reducing monster's DEF to 0 for 20 seconds.

[120] Glorious Sanctuary: For the Rest of Heroes
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: (a) Holy Water of Armonia x5; (b) Expert G EXP Card x10, White Gold Bar x2.
  1. Talk to Blacksmith Bryan in Armonia Apostadero (D8).
  2. Talk to Commander William in Armonia Apostadero (H8) for reward (a).
  3. Kill Corrupted Lanceman x30 and Corrupted Guard x30 in Armonia En Celar.
    • The monsters deals physical damage, so [Protection Field] buff will help.
  4. Talk to Commander William in Armonia Apostadero (H8) for reward (b).

[120] Glorious Sanctuary: Everyone Is Involved
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: Tears of Sara (Event) x3, White Gold Bar x3, Expert G EXP Card x20.
  1. Collect Earring of Cepheus x1 which is dropped by monsters in Armonia En Celar.
    • Earring of Cepheus is a tradable item under [Misc.] tab of the inventory.
    • The drop rate is horrendous in v21.77.84. Consider using Field Manual, Explorer Pack (aka Home Premium Service), Pan Pan, etc. to boost drop rate.
    • Spending too long in En Celar will increase [Degenerate] curse level. Summoners are less affected by this, since ATK penalty does not apply to the summoned monsters.
    • If you use summoners, bring along a tank. Montoro's skills clear mobs well with an anti-demon rod. Lisa's high evasion may help her survive as well.
  2. Talk to Commander William in Armonia Apostadero (H8) to give him Earring of Cepheus.
  3. Trigger a quest dialogue at Armonia En Celar (D7).
  4. Trigger a combat mission ("I Will Save Them!", 30 minutes) at Armonia En Celar (F5).
    • Reduce Priest Cepheus Jonathan to 50% HP. Vincent and Sirius will help you. Archbishop Bruno will then appear.
    • Reduce Archbishop Bruno to 50% HP. Vincent and Sirius will help you.
    • Tip: At the start, run away to let Vincent and Sirius occupy the monster, while you buff up.
    • Tip: Sirius' normal attacks can inflict [Armor Crash] status, reducing monster's DEF to 0 for 20 seconds.
    • Tip: Use a long range shooter (e.g. Leonele) to stay out of their area attacks, and capitalize on [Armor Crash] status.
    • Tip: Archbishop Bruno seems to change targets more easily, so you may want to bring along a tank as well.
  5. Talk to Commander William in Armonia Apostadero (H8).
  6. Talk to Archbishop Vega in Armonia Cathedral (D4) for reward.
Note: This completes Armonia Episode 1 scenario, and is followed by Sirius Recruitment quests.

RECRUITMENT QUEST

[120] The Forest Guardian Nena: The Forest Guardian
Prerequisites: Completed Bahama Episode 2 scenario.
  1. Talk to Nena in the Prophet's Forest (E7).
  2. Talk to Sierra in Witch's Room. To enter the room, talk to Leonora in Witch's House via Bahama Swamp of Eternity (G6).
  3. Talk to Nena in the Prophet's Forest (E7) to start a combat mission ("Remnants Defeating", 15 minutes).
    • Kill a set number of Golden Honeycombs and Snake Flowers (Wildlife • AR/DR 65).
    • Tip: Nena will assist you in the fight. Sierra will periodically tell you how many monsters you still have to kill.

[120] The Forest Guardian Nena: Nena
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: Expert G EXP Card x3.
  1. Talk to Nena in the Prophet's Forest (E7).
  2. Kill Golden Honeycomb x100 and Snake Flower x100 in the Prophet's Forest. Both types of monsters are Wildlife.
  3. Talk to Nena in the Prophet's Forest (E7) for reward.

[120] The Forest Guardian Nena: Altar Protection
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: Expert G EXP Card x3.
  1. Click on the Stone With Mysterious Energy at the Prophet's Forest (D3) to start the daily raid mission.
    • Kill all 3 wildlife bosses - Phantom of Ruincruger, Phantom of Ruinmeladue, and Divino.
    • Note: You need Expedition Memo x30 + Silver Bar x3 to enter the mission. Up to 12 players can join the same mission.
  2. Talk to Nena in the Prophet's Forest (E7) for reward.

[120] The Forest Guardian Nena: Nena
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: Expert G EXP Card x3, Triumph Filler (Event) x1.
  1. Talk to Nena in the Prophet's Forest (E7). She will ask for these items:
    • Honey x10 - available in personal farm.
    • Beet x10 - available in personal farm.
    • Cook Stone x100 - available via Alchemy Grade 0-9 roulettes.
  2. Talk to Nena in the Prophet's Forest (E7) to give her the above items in exchange for the reward.

[120] The Forest Guardian Nena: Sierra's Work
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. Trigger a combat mission ("Altar Cleaning", 15 minutes) at the Heaven's Altar (E6).
    • Destroy all 4 gates - Summoning Spells (Object • DR 67 • DEF 300 • RES 50-90). Each gate is attuned to a different element, thus the specific RES varies from gate to gate.
    • Tip: Various guardian monsters, such as Vespanola Soldier and Werewolf, (DR 62-66) will appear out of the gates. They will automatically disappear when their respective gates are destroyed.

[120] The Forest Guardian Nena: The Forest Guardian
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. Talk to Sierra in Witch's Room.

[120] The Forest Guardian Nena: Advice
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: Expert G EXP Card x3.
  1. Talk to Ramiro in Reboldoeux Queen's Gate.
  2. Talk to Andre in Cite de Reboldoeux.
  3. Talk to Soso in Gigante Port.
  4. Talk to Karjalainen in City of Auch.
  5. Talk to Lisa in Port of Coimbra for reward.
  6. Talk to Sierra in Witch's Room. You must choose one of the following items as a gift for Nena. The item is not consumed...
    • Growth Stone (100,000 feso)
    • +6 Lv.92 Elite La Ventisca
    • +6 Lv.100 Carbon Knuckle
    • Emerald + Ruby + Sapphire
    • Killer Chocolate (available from Lisa after completing Soho's sub-quest)

[120] The Forest Guardian Nena: Gift of Sierra
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. Talk to Nena in the Prophet's Forest (E7) to start a combat mission ("Important Mission", 10 minutes).
    • Reduce Nena to 20% HP. Her buffed statistics are indicated in brackets below.
    • Note: At 80% HP, [Power of Fire] status will grant her more ATK Rating and ATK.
    • Note: At 60% HP, [Power of Land] status will grant her more DEF Rating and DEF.
    • Note: At 40% HP, [Power of Wind] and [Power of Water] statuses will grant her more ATK Speed, Movement Speed, HP Regeneration, and RES.
Nena• Lv.130 Human • Light Armor • None • Small
HP 5,409,600 • ATK Rating 67 (72) • ATK 15,120 (27,216) • DEF Rating 67 (69) • DEF 225 (245)
Penetration 0 • Magic Penetration - Fire 0, Ice 0, Lightning 0, Mental 0
Immunity 0 • RES - Fire 70 (90), Ice 70 (90), Lightning 70 (90), Mental 60 (80)

[120] The Forest Guardian Nena: Nena
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. Talk to Nena in Prophet's Forest (E7).

[120] The Forest Guardian Nena: Duty of the Demigod
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: Expert G EXP Card x3, Nena Character Card.
  1. Talk to Sierra in Witch's Room.
  2. Talk to Nena in the Prophet's Forest (E7) for reward.

item.title: Episode 2
item.author: chikodaniel
item.description:
[120] The Heaven's Altar: A Serious Call
Prerequisites: Complete Bahama Episode 1 scenario.
  1. Trigger quest mail by moving to Bahama Base Camp.
  2. Talk to Sierra in Witch's Room to start a combat mission ("Why!?", 20 minutes). To enter the room, talk to Leonora in Witch's House via Bahama Swamp of Eternity (G6).
  3. Reduce Sierra to 75% HP. You will lose Refined Holy Water (quest item).
Sierra • Lv.120 Human • Soft Armor • None • Medium
HP 18,876,000 • ATK Rating 67 • ATK 18,270 • DEF Rating 65 • DEF 205
Penetration 0 • Magic Penetration - Fire 0, Ice 0, Lightning 0, Mental 0
Immunity 45 • RES - Fire 70, Ice 70, Lightning 70, Mental 70

[120] The Heaven's Altar: What Is Sierra's Purpose?
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. Talk to Leonora in Witch's House.

[120] The Heaven's Altar: A Conspiracy of Two Women
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. Trigger a combat mission ("A Conspiracy of Two Women", 20 minutes) at the Prophet's Forest (G10).
    • Reduce Angry Beatrice to 50% HP. You can ignore Angry Sharon (DR 97).
  2. Trigger quest dialogue at the Prophet's Forest (E3).
Angry Beatrice • Lv.130 Human • Soft Armor • None • Small
HP 11,592,000 • ATK Rating 67 • ATK 12,150 • DEF Rating 67 • DEF 150
Penetration 30 • Magic Penetration - Fire 0, Ice 0, Lightning 0, Mental 0
Immunity 30 • RES - Fire 70, Ice 70, Lightning 70, Mental 70

Angry Sharon • Lv.130 Human • Soft Armor • None • Medium
HP 7,728,000 • ATK Rating 70 • ATK 4,050 • DEF Rating 97 • DEF 287
Penetration 0 • Magic Penetration - Fire 0, Ice 0, Lightning 0, Mental 0
Immunity 0 • RES - Fire 70, Ice 70, Lightning 70, Mental 70

[120] The Heaven's Altar: Seal of Demigod
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. Talk to Leonora in Witch's House.
  2. Talk to Leonora again to select one of the following items to give her. You may change the required item any time before completing it.
    • Growth Stone x2 (100,000 feso each)
    • Elemental Jewel x3
    • Rhodolite Piece x100 + Liquified Gas x50 + Otite Piece x500 + Ice Crystal x200
  3. Talk to Leonora again to gain Refined Energy Source of Elements (quest item).

[120] The Heaven's Altar: To the Heaven's Altar
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. Trigger a combat mission ("First Sheol", 30 minutes) at the Prophet's Forest (D3).

[120] The Heaven's Altar: A Blocker
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. This quest starts with the previously triggered combat mission ("First Sheol", 30 minutes).
    • Reduce Nena to 50% HP. You will lose Refined Energy Source of Elements (quest item).
Nena • Lv.130 Human • Light Armor • None • Small
HP 5,409,600 • ATK Rating 67 • ATK 15,120 • DEF Rating 67 • DEF 225
Penetration 0 • Magic Penetration - Fire 0, Ice 0, Lightning 0, Mental 0
Immunity 0 • RES - Fire 70, Ice 70, Lightning 70, Mental 60

[120] The Heaven's Altar: The End of the Forest Guardian
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. Trigger a combat mission ("The Last Guardian", 30 minutes) at the Prophet's Forest (D3).
    • Use the quest version of Nena (MCC1) to kill all the monsters - Ruinmeladues and Horrible Stonecrugers.
    • Tip: Nena is equipped with +7 Greek Croma for Fighter (DEF+20, DR+3) and +7 Strata Devil Polearm (ATK 40%, ATK Speed 30%, Critical +15, ATK to Wildlife +90%, 3S HP Absorb 4% x3). Her [Vigilar] stance is at Lv.25, but all skills are at Lv.1.
    • Tip: There is a mob in the east. Lure them over one or two at a time.
    • Tip: Buff [Invertir] skill. If you want to tank more mobs at the same time, use defensive version.
    • Tip: Use normal attacks (spacebar) to heal herself with the HP Absorb rumins.
    • Tip: Use recovery poses to regain HP/SP. You may not summon pets or use potions.
Ruinmeladue • Lv.118 Wildlife • Soft Armor • None • Medium
HP 73,666 • ATK Rating 65 • ATK 9,936 • DEF Rating 60 • DEF 172
Penetration 30 • Magic Penetration - Fire 0, Ice 0, Lightning 0, Mental 0
Immunity 0 • RES - Fire 25, Ice 60, Lightning 50, Mental 50

Horrible Stonecruger • Lv.118 Wildlife • Light Armor • None • Medium
HP 73,666 • ATK Rating 66 • ATK 7,452 • DEF Rating 61 • DEF 207
Penetration 0 • Magic Penetration - Fire 0, Ice 0, Lightning 0, Mental 0
Immunity 0 • RES - Fire 25, Ice 50, Lightning 50, Mental 50

[120] The Heaven's Altar: The Truth of the Five Elements
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. Trigger a combat mission ("Distorted History & the Truth", 30 minutes) at the Heaven's Altar (G10), which can be entered from the Prophet's Forest (D3).
    • Reduce Fragment of Abyss, Madness to 50% HP.
    • Tip: The monster can inflict [Stun] status, which can be removed with [Refresh Mind] skill.
    • Tip: If you do not have a tank, use [Protection Field] skill or use Valeria's [Satisfy] skill to quickly restore the stunned character's HP.
  2. Trigger a combat mission ("Elements Control", 30 minutes) at Heaven's Altar (G9).
    • Click on all 4 paladions to activate them.
    • Click on the 4 paladions in the following order to stabilize them - bottom right (wind) > top left (water) > top right (fire) > bottom left (land).
Fragment of Abyss, Madness • Lv.120 Demon • Light Armor • None • Medium
HP 27,456,000 • ATK Rating 67 • ATK 47,250 • DEF Rating 65 • DEF 175
Penetration 0 • Magic Penetration - Fire 0, Ice 0, Lightning 0, Mental 0
Immunity 0 • RES - Fire 60, Ice 60, Lightning 60, Mental 60



[120] The Heaven's Altar: Situation of Sierra
Reward: Expert G EXP Card x30, Training Card G (Event) x20.
  1. Talk to Sierra in Witch's Room for reward.

[120] The Heaven's Altar: Whereabouts of Jurgen
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
  1. Talk to Grandma in Ustiur Base Camp to start a non-combat mission ("Whereabouts of Jurgen").

[120] The Heaven's Altar: Finding the Last Element
Prerequisites: Completed the quests above.
Reward: Expert G EXP Card x20.
  1. Talk to Sierra in Witch's Room for reward.
Note: This quest completes Bahama Episode 2 and is followed by Recruit Nena quests.
